sen.j: 丁髷（ちょんまげ）とは江戸時代の老人が結う男髷。
sen.e: Chonmage (a topnot) is a topknot for old men in the Edo period.
Chonmage is a topknot tied by old men in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内省略しました。

sen.j: 髪の少ない老人が結う小ぶりな髷をその形から「ゝ髷」（ちょんまげ）と言った。
sen.e: From the small shape of topnot for old men's thin hair, it was called as "chonmage".
From the shape of the small topknot tied by old men having a thin head of hair, it was called "chonmage."
sen.cmt: 文法・句点修正しました。
sen.e: From the shape of the small topknot tied by old men having a thin head of hair, it was called "chonmage."

sen.j: 現在丁髷と呼ばれるものは時代劇などでよく登場する銀杏髷、本多髷や相撲の力士が結う大銀杏で本来の丁髷では無い。
sen.e: Today, ichomage (a hair-style like a fan, like the leaf of the sacred gingko tree) and hondamage, often seen in the period dramas, and oicho for sumo wrestlers are called as chonmage, but those topnots are not original chonmage.
sen.cmt: 銀杏髷は、用語集の(ichomage (a hair-style like a fan, like the leaf of the sacred gingko tree))にしました。
sen.e: Today, ichomage (a hair-style like a fan, like the leaf of the sacred gingko tree), hondamage, which is often seen in period dramas, and oicho tied by sumo wrestlers are called chonmage, but those chonmage are not quintessential.

sen.j: 現在見られるものでは力士が稽古時に結う髪型が月代（さかやき）は剃っていないものの一番近い。
sen.e: Although sakayaki (shaved part of the forehead) is not shaved, the topnot tied by sumo wrestlers at training time is the closest one among the topnots seen today.
Among chonmage today, sumo wrestlers' hair style at training time is the most similar to the quintessential chonmage although they do not have part of their forehead shaved.

sen.j: 明治4年8月9日に散髪脱刀勝手令（いわゆる断髪令）が太政官布告された。
sen.e: Sanpatsudattokatterei (so-called dampatsurei (order of bobbed hair)) was issued as dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State) on Aug. 9, 1871.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処散髪脱刀勝手令は、用語集の散髪脱刀勝手令Sanpatsudattokatterei (order of bobbed hair)と断髪令をまとめました。太政官布告は、用語集のDajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State)を使用しました。
sen.e: Sanpatsudattokatterei (so-called dampatsurei [order of bobbed hair]) was issued as Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State) on August 9, 1871.
sen.cmt: ダブルカッコの処理修正しました。
sen.e: Sanpatsudattokatterei (so-called dampatsurei [order of bobbed hair]) was issued as Dajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State) on August 9, 1871.

sen.j: さらに明治6年明治天皇の断髪に至ると、伝統的な男髷を結う男性は激減し、洋髪やざんぎり頭が流行した。
sen.e: In 1873, the Emperor Meiji turned to have a bobbed hair, and men who tied traditional topnots for men decreased drastically and western style hair and cut-off hair were in fashion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処散髪脱刀勝手令は、用語集の散髪脱刀勝手令Sanpatsudattokatterei (order of bobbed hair)と断髪令をまとめました。太政官布告は、用語集のDajokan fukoku (proclamation by the Grand Council of State)を使用しました。洋髪やざんぎり頭は、用語集になかったので、western style hair and cut-off hairとしました。
sen.e: In 1873, the Emperor Meiji turned to bobbed hair, and men who tied traditional topknots for men decreased in numbers drastically and the western hair style and the shortcut hair style became widespread instead.

sen.j: それでもなお保守的な男髷姿の人を（半ば揶揄して）「丁髷頭」と呼ぶようになり、現在、この呼称が男髷全体の名称として用いられるようになった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, people who are conservative and still have topnots for men were called as "chonmage atama" (in a slightly playful way), and this naming has used for the name of all topnots for men.
Nevertheless, conservative people who still tied topknots for men were called 'chonmage atama' (in a playful way), and this naming has been used as the general term for topknots for men.

sen.j: 絵画、浮世絵、歌舞伎、時代劇などに出てくる頭頂部を剃った丁髷の髪型に多くの人々が、日々剃刀などで整えることは、予想以上に手間のかかることである。
sen.e: Unexpectedly, it takes a lot of trouble for many people to trim their hair with razors every day for chonmage hairstyle, which is shaved on the top of the head seen in the painting, ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints), kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), and period dramas, etc.

sen.j: その必要性の背景を明らかにすることは、断髪令以前の社会を更に理解することにつながると思われる。
sen.e: It would appear that making clear the background of the needs for it directs toward a better understanding of the society before dampatsurei.

sen.j: また、幼児向けの漫画やキャラクター商品で「ちょんまげ」と称しているものは簡略化されているが、後頭部から垂直に髷を巻き立て毛先を円形に広げていることから茶筅髷を参考にしていると思われる。
sen.e: In addition, "chonmage" in the cartoons and character goods for infants is simplified, and mage (a chignon) is rolled up vertically from the back of the head and tips of the mage is spreaded roundly, so it seems to refer to chasenmage (a hair-style like a tea whisk).

On the other hand, 'chonmage' seen in cartoons and character goods is simplified, which simplified chonmage may be based on chasenmage (a hair-style like a tea whisk) because mage (topknot) is rolled up vertically from the back of the head with the tips of hair spread roundly.
sen.cmt: 因果関係の明確化しました。
